avalancheActivity.comment: Few small slabs released in Hengill area in westerly aspects. Snowgroomer triggerd a small slab with cornice collapse in Bláfjöll
avalancheActivity.highlights: Loose snow and windslabs in most aspects. Shallow weakness but the bond with old firn seems to be good.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow from late desember that has been transported and is starting to settle. About 40 cm of newsnow/windslab since new year. Snowpit from Bláfjöll showed shallow weakness in the new snow. Bonding with old firn seems to be good.

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow fell in E-winds in the north and the east and there is considerable amount of snow in the mountains. Instability could be between the layers of this snow and the older freeze-thaw snow. A weak layer is assumed to be present in the snowpack high in the mountains in the north. Avalanches fell all around the country in a melting episode in early January but the snowpack has frozen again since then and is considered more stable.
travelAdvisory.highlights: New snow fell in E-winds in the north and the east and there is considerable amount of snow in the mountains. Instability could be between the layers of this snow and the older freeze-thaw snow.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlæg átt og einhver él til fjalla. Frost nokkur stig til fjalla

avalancheActivity.comment: Wet slab released in Kirkjubólshlíð. No other reports of recent avalanches since the avalanche cycle over Xmas
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has started to settle but fresh windslabs expected in westerly aspects. Moist or wet snow at lower elevation.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable amount new snow came in NE winds about a week ago and a few dry slabs fell. Snow should gain strength next days.

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow fell in E-winds in the north and the east and there is considerable amount of snow in the mountains. Instability could be between the layers of this snow and the older freeze-thaw snow. A weak layer is assumed to be present in the snowpack high in the mountains in the north. Avalanches fell all around the country in a melting episode in early January but the snowpack has frozen again since then and is considered more stable.
travelAdvisory.highlights: New snow fell in E-winds in the north and the east and there is considerable amount of snow in the mountains. Instability could be between the layers of this snow and the older freeze-thaw snow.

weatherForecast.highlights: A-átt of einhver él til fjalla, en skammvinn vestanátt með snjókomum á föstudag. Milt í veðri og hiti nokkrar gráður á láglendi og um frostmark í fjöllum.

avalancheActivity.comment: Large avalanches were recorded in Skíðadalur on January 2nd and likely released due to warming on 1st and 2nd of January. A size 2.5 avalanche was likely released by snowmobilers in Hólsdalur on Dec 30th. An avalanche was reported on S aspect in Ólafsfjörður Dec 31st. Another large avalanche, size 3.5 was released on SW facing aspect in Hestskarðshnjúkur on Dec 30th as well as a few smaller ones.
avalancheActivity.highlights: On Monday and Tuesday warming reached up to around 600 m and has strengthened the snowpack after subsequent cooling, forming a crust in mid elevations. Above, the snow is still dry and persistant weakness can be found in the snow pack in upper elecations.New snow is covering the region and may blow into slabs in NE-winds in northernmost Tröllaskagi.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow is covering the region and has fallen in low winds although wind slabs might form in northernmost part of Tröllaskagi in NE-directions. Jan 1st and 2nd, warming reached up to 600 m and has strenghtened the snow, forming a crust in mid elevations. Above, snow is dry and persistant weakness can be found in the snow pack. Wind slabs have formed since in most aspects after significant snowing recently, mostly in S and W aspects. Warming in the beginning of the year up to 5-600 m has likely strengthened the snow pack and decreased temperature gradient, although it may still be steeper in upper elevations and may be enhanced further in cooling of the next few days.

travelAdvisory.comment: New snow fell in E-winds in the north and the east and there is considerable amount of snow in the mountains. Instability could be between the layers of this snow and the older freeze-thaw snow. A weak layer is assumed to be present in the snowpack high in the mountains in the north. Avalanches fell all around the country in a melting episode in early January but the snowpack has frozen again since then and is considered more stable.

weatherForecast.highlights: Eftir éljagang á fimmtudag má gera ráð fyrir lítilli úrkomu fram yfir helgi. Kólnar áfram fram að sunnudegi en hlýindi taka við á sunnudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Many wet slabs (size 2-3) in a avalanche cycle 1.-2. of jan. Most released at around 400-500 m elevation and westerly aspects.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of new snow in the mountains but rain in lower elevations. Dry snow high in mountains, chances of wet avalanches at lower elevation on Thursday

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow came during NE-E storm 1.-2. of jan. Thaw and rain has wettened the snow but less effects are at higher elevations. Old firn/crust after melt/freeze cycle before xmas in some places under the new snow and many wet slabs seem to have released on this layer in a avalance cycle 1.-2. of jan. Snowpit from Oddsskarð showed some facets below the crust.

Avalanches fell all around the country in a melting episode in early January but the snowpack has frozen again since then and is considered more stable.

weatherForecast.highlights: Spáð smá NA-snjókomu til fjalla en rigningu neðan til. Úrkomulítið um helgina. Fremur milt en hlýnar með skammvinnri austan rigningu fimmtudagskvöld en snjokomu til fjalla.
